description: This course examines the process of literary development in English during two
consecutive and contrasting movements: the Neoclassical (1660-1780) and Romantic
(1780-1840). Students read the works of representative and important writers from both
periods, including Pope, Swift, Austen, Wordsworth, Blake, Shelley, Emerson, Douglass,
and others, and examine the development of styles, conventions, and forms in English,
Irish, and American literatures. Offered periodically. Prerequisite: WRIT 120 or equivalent.
